review: Bystolic (nebivolol):Male 62 - reasonably fit. I am on Valsartan and my BP was generally 160/90. I exercise regularly and had started yoga in Dec 2021. Nothing lowered my BP. My PCP prescribed 5 mg of Bystolic (in addition to the Valsartan) in February 2022 to help lower my BP and it has worked like a charm. My BP is now 125/65 with a heart rate generally in the 50s if at rest and in the 70s if active. I have not experienced any side effects that I am aware of. For me, this drug has been a Godsend.

I never have had this issue before and I’m a bit freaked out. Anyone other males have this issue?  I’m 53 male.

I should know because I've been taking Bystolic for almost 9 years. At present, I would not accept any other Generic manufacturer. If this generic is not available, I would either switch to brand or switch to a different beta blocker.

Even when I miss a dose, I measure my BP, it doesn't raise the BP. It's my morning dose every day. At night I take Telmisartan/Amlodipine.

Bystolic (nebivolol):I began taking Bystolic 5mg for high blood pressure, heart racing. After years of being put on other meds and not being able to tolerate them Bystolic has not only lowered my bp it has made me feel great again. My daughter even asked what I had been doing to see such a change. I personally give this medicine a 10. Everyone should remember our bodies are all different what is good for me may not work for someone else. DNA testing can tell which meds a person can tolerate and which ones that would not agree.

Bystolic (nebivolol):I had high blood pressure for years. After taking many different drugs, my doctor suggested these. They work very well with no side effects!

Great news is that a generic has finally been released by ANI pharmaceuticals, hopefully I can save some money and begin the generic because the price was way too high.

56 year old female with Cardiomyopathy. Metopolol for me was not good . I tried about 6 different beta blockers and ARBs for cardiomyopathy and cardiac sarcoidosis before landing on this one these past 3 months. This both keeps my heart rate steady and takes away palpitations with very little side effects. I bike 50 miles a week and play competitive pickle ball on most days on this med. I also purposely take it in the morning to improve my focus at work, which is another benefit but only if I take in the am.

Bystolic (nebivolol):I am a thin lady in my mid-forties, who has had issues with increasing blood pressure over the last few years but worse the past year, as readings were around 175/105 daily.  I know most people report no symptoms with high BP, but I feel bad when mine is up - headache, and just an overall ill feeling.  I finally went to the doctor and was prescribed 10 mg Bystolic, and although it has only been one week (so I can't give a long term review), I feel SO much better.  BP is now 123/83, and HR has gone from around 88 to 62. Apart  from helping the BP, I also feel less anxious and no longer get those jolts of stress-related adrenaline rushes.  So calm, and just feel 100% better overall.  The only side effect I can report is occasional shortness of breath about 2-3 hrs before my next dose.  Then after the medication,  it goes away.  I have headaches too, but I frequently have headaches and doubt it's related to the medication. Overall, I am thrilled and thankful to be on this medication!

Have tried twice to get off this drug from hell and failed, palpitations and anxiety attacks, weight gain, memory loss you name it.My cardio doc recently switched me to bisoprolol-zebeta a little better but still unable to completely get off these damned beta blockers, HELP !!!

Bystolic (nebivolol):55 years old, been taking 5 mg daily for over 10 years, never have had to increase dosage! Works great at controlling blood pressure for me! Very pleased.Question though - has anyone noticed increased urination with this medication? I googled this to see if this med or bp meds in general are diuretics but didn't really find anything. Thanks and wishing you all good health.

Bystolic (nebivolol):I took Bystolic 3 days ago (5mg) after being on metoprolol 25mg for 4yrs.  Like night-day. NO side effects for me. HUGE difference on day 1 I’m in early 60’s, no medical conditions either not diabetic/overweight, exercising 14 yrs in very good health. Metoprolol about ruined me. Felt like someone was sitting on my chest, blurred vision, insomnia, extreme fatigue, light sensitivity, no motivation, borderline depression. I had a very bad reaction to it. Both Rx’s took BP from 140/80 to 120/70.  I now sleep 7-8hrs a night, (4-6 on metoprolol). My thinking is clear on Bystolic too; no fog brain. Bystolic is like taking a daily vitamin; I take it and forget it; afterwards feel ok all day and night. Metoprolol was like sitting in an oxygen deprivation tank, fatigued, tired, half knocked out, unable to sleep more than 2 hrs at a time; it was debilitating for me. Bystolic is worth every penny to me.

Bystolic (nebivolol):Wonderful drug! From the first week, my rapid heart beat was back to normal, my social anxiety nerves were greatly reduced. My blood pressure is now down to 110/65 from being sky high. My heart used to beat at 95-100 bpm when I walked or was stressed. It's now at 55-60. I have NO side effects: no ED (it works fine for an older man), no nightmares as some have had, no weight gain, no sleepiness, no fatigue. Nothing but a peaceful easy feeling, to quote a song. Highly recommend it. The only downside is that it is expensive. Glad I have good insurance!

Bystolic (nebivolol):I have had high blood pressure for years and take all the types of medications for it. One appointment a couple of years ago I complained to my doc about feeling very weak sometimes so he prescribed Bystolic and it does wonders, gets me back on my feet.

Bystolic (nebivolol):I trialed Metoprolol, Diltiazem, and Coreg prior to Bystolic (for treatment of PSVT, atrial tachycardia, PAC's/PVC's). Metoprolol made me ill, Diltiazem was ineffective and caused me to hear my heartbeat all day and night long, and Coreg was great at lowering my HR, but inefficient at preventing my palpitations and SVT events. I've been on Bystolic (lowest possible dosage) for 2-3 months and my palpitations/events have drastically been reduced. My HR has gone from 115 resting to about 90, which I am so thankful for. I was hesitant to take this medication because of other patients' reports of headaches, but I take mine before bed and have had no issues. I can't say that I've had any side effects, to be honest. I'm really impressed with this drug. It's given me back a bit of normalcy in my life.

Bystolic (nebivolol):I have had extremely high blood pressure (195/100 -259/105) since January after an injection I received which landed me in Emergency room 3 times and 19 doctor visits since then.
